Dear Sir,

I am getting mad :( .
I am getting sound over serial port , and I use WaveFilewriter class to write data to it at the DataReceived Event . It works great . Thanks,

But ,at a certain time , I need to add a byte array to the WaveFileWriter. I fist save this byte array to the WaveFileWriter by Mywriter.Write(fileByte, 0, fileByte.Length - 1) . then I continue to add data received from the serial port normally. NB. this byte Array I add is amplified (by converting to float , then multiply , then convert to byte again)

Problem ,
When I run the recorded file , it works great for the audio coming from the serial port , and for the sound that is added manually , but after this any sound coming from the serial port is recorded in a very very high volume. I do not know why.

Any Idea ?

Thanks for the great control and for the Excellent support.
Waleed
Can you show us the code? It is difficult to see the problem otherwise.
